numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a correlation between family wealth and admission to an Ivy League college.
2. If a student and the family of the student are wealthier, then the student has a higher chance of admission to an Ivy League college.
4. A student in the top 0.1% is 7 times more likely to get into an Ivy League college than other students.
5. I wonder whether Ivy League colleges focus more on the wealth and status of a student than on the academic success of the student.
6. I wonder whether Ivy League colleges focus more on the wealth and status of a student than on the abilities of the student.
7. It seems that Ivy League colleges prefer richer students.
8. It seems that Ivy League colleges favor wealthier students.
9. This makes me question whether Ivy League colleges are for the wealthiest students rather than for the smartest students.
10. This relates to me and my community.
11. Many people in my community dream of attending an Ivy League school.
12. Many people in my community do not have the status that these schools favor.
13. If a person does not have this status, then the chance of admission is very low.
14. Some people think that such a person needs a miracle to have a chance to attend these schools.
15. The headline is: Is your social status worthy enough for the Ivy Leagues?
